comments.body: This is really stupid, but I can't figure out how to get that environment variable to the lookup plugin other than this. Would love some guidance.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +3,7 @@    name: openshift

# TODO: This is the only way I could get the kubeconfig, I don't know why. Running the lookup outside of debug seems to return an empty string
- debug: msg={{ lookup('env', 'K8S_AUTH_KUBECONFIG') }}
  register: kubeconfig
